resource.name: County/Metro Indicator - High Blood Pressure
resource.description: UCLA Center for Health Policy Research. AskCHIS 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2009, 2011-2016. Ever diagnosed with high blood pressure (San Bernardino County, State of California). Available at ask.chis.ucla.edu. Exported on March 14th, 2019.
resource.attribution: UCLA, Center for Health Policy Research

resource.name: CHA Neighborhood Ratings
resource.description: Residents at community engagement events were provided surveys and asked to rate their neighborhood across the areas of: 1) Health and Wellness, 2) Economy, 3) Safety, 4) Education, 5) Transportation, 6) Environment, and 7) Housing.  This data presents the results of those ratings along with respondent demographics.  Each row represents a single residents responses.
resource.attribution: Dept. of Public Health - Research, Assessment, & Planning Unit
columns_description: Self reported location of residence of the respondent.
Self reported age of the respondent.
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood economy
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood health and wellness
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood housing
Unique identifier to distinguish a specific respondent
Self reported race/ethnicity of the respondent.
Self reported annual household income of the respondent.
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood education
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood environment
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood safety
Self reported highest level of education completed of the respondent.
Rating based on poor, fair, good, very good, and excellent scale for neighborhood transportation
Self reported sex of the respondent.

resource.name: Maternal Mental Health Screenings
resource.description: At least 50% of Comprehensive Perinatal Program (CPSP) providers and Federally Qualified Health Centers/Rural Health Clinics will adopt and implement Maternal Mental Health screening and referral into their practices when providing preconception, perinatal and postpartum services by June 30, 2018.
columns_name: Adopted protocols to screen for PMAD with validated tool?
Did provider use the PHDQ-9 or Edinburg postpartum depression scale? If yes, which scale was used?
Maternal Mental Health referral implemented  when neded
Provider implements Maternal Mental Health Screenings (1=Yes, 0=No)

resource.description: Increase the percentage of food facilities in an elevated risk tier that demonstrates improvement in their safe food handling practices to 85% by June 30, 2021.

resource.name: Partnership to Increase Health Education in School Sites
resource.description: Partner with 100 qualifying school and afterschool sites to train teachers to implement curricula in the classroom that increases the nutrition and/or physical activity education offered to students by September 30, 2017.

resource.name: Health Insurance Coverage
resource.description: Annual data on the percent of the population with health insurance coverage for the County of San Bernardino, State of California, and the United States. Numerator and denominator data derived from U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey.

resource.name: County/Metro Indicator - Underemployment
resource.description:
Percentage of the civilian labor force plus the marginally attached who were unemployed, marginally attached, or part-time for economic reasons.

U.S. Census Bureau, Current Population Survey, Basic Monthly Data.

Note: The sample includes respondents that had been surveyed for the first time in the CPS Basic Monthly (i.e. HRMIS = 1).
columns_description: The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that were Looking for Work in the past 12 months but have given up
The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that are not Looking for Work because of lack of faith in the job market
Percentage of the Labor Force Plus the Marginally Attached, that are either Looking for Work, Marginally Attached or are Working Part-Time for Economic Reasons
The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that are Employed Part-Time (< 35 Hours), want to work full-time, but do not For Economic Reasons
Percentage of Civilians that are either Employed or Looking for Work
Percentage of the Labor Force that are Looking for Work
The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that are Employed or Looking for Work
The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that are Employed
The Civilian Population 16 Years and Over that are Looking for Work

resource.name: Review & Distribution of Healthy Communities Evaluation
resource.description: Review and distribute results of the Healthy Communities evaluation with all seven participating cities by July 31, 2017.

resource.description: At least 100 of current staff will have created an Individual Development Plan (IDP) by June 30, 2021.

resource.name: Healthy Retail Recognition Program
resource.description: Develop and pilot a Healthy Retail Recognition Program to promote healthy food and beverage options in two qualifying neighborhood retailers, by September 30, 2019.

resource.name: Vector Surveillance to Promote Safe Open Spaces & Trails

resource.name: Vision2BActive
resource.description: Promote the Vision2BActive initiative and website at 20 local events throughout the county by December 31, 2017.

resource.name: CHA Engagement Priorities
resource.description: Resident and stakeholder health and community priorities based on engagement surveys distributed by the Community Vital Signs Committee and the Department of Public Health.  Each respondent provided seven (7) top health issues and five (5) top community priorities (within the Safety, Education, and Economy priority areas) that they wanted to see addressed.
resource.attribution: Dept. of Public Health - Research, Assessment, & Planning Unit
columns_description: Self reported race/ethnicity of the respondent.
Self reported location of residence of the respondent.
Self reported age of the respondent.

Unique identifier to distinguish a specific respondent (each unique number will end with a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, or 7 for the same respondent to identify different priorities selected by the same respondent).
Self reported annual household income of the respondent.
Self reported highest level of education completed of the respondent.
Identifies whether the respondent was a community resident or stakeholder (non-profit, government, community leader, etc. staff person/volunteeer who works in the County of San Bernardino).
Self reported sex of the respondent.
Identifies one of the five health top safety, education, or economy priorities to address as identified by the respondent.
Identifies one of the seven top health priorities to address as identified by the respondent.

resource.name: Department Emergency Planning
resource.description: At least 66% of all annexes in the Department Emergency Operations Plan will be reviewed and updated if necessary by June 30, 2020.

resource.name: County/Metro Indicator - Suicide
resource.description:
NUMERATOR:	California Department of Public Health (CDPH), Center for Health Statistics and Informatics. Death Statistical Master File.
https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CHSI/Pages/Data-Applications.aspx

DENOMINATOR:	U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 1-Year Summary File Estimates, Table B01001.
https://factfinder.census.gov/bkmk/table/1.0/en/ACS/16_1YR/B01001/0100000US%7C0400000US06%7C0500000US06071

National Baseline:	11.3 suicides per 100,000 population occurred in 2007 (age adjusted to the year 2000 standard population)
Goal: To meet the target suicide rate of 10.2 suicides per 100,000 population

https://www.healthypeople.gov/node/4804/data_details
columns_description: Suicide Rate per 100,000 People in San Bernardino County

resource.name: Workforce Engagement through Department-wide Committees
resource.description: All four department wide committees will meet at least eight times each fiscal year.
columns_description: Number of meetings in a fiscal year as of current date.

resource.name: County/Metro Indicator - Crime Rate
resource.description:
Sources: 
Numerator: California Department of Justice, Open Justice. Crimes and Clearances.

resource.name: San Bernardino County City Boundaries
resource.description:
Cartographic Boundary Shapefiles - Places 
The cartographic boundary files are simplified representations of selected geographic areas from the Census Bureau’s MAF/TIGER geographic database. These boundary files are specifically designed for small scale thematic mapping.

resource.name: Fitness Classes Offered at Health Centers
resource.description: The Ontario and Hesperia Federally Qualified Health Centers will offer at least one ongoing fitness class at their location by June 30, 2018.
columns_description: Date of when the first fitness class was introduced

resource.name: County/Metro Indicator - Retail Food Environment Index
resource.description:
U.S. Census Bureau. (2018). Economy Wide Statistics Division, County Business Patterns (2013-2016). Accessed July 18th, 2018.


Definition:
Retail Food Environment Index (RFEI) is the ratio of convenience stores (excluding gas stations convenience stores), limited-service restaurants (aka fast food restaurants), and full-service restaurants TO supermarkets and specialty food stores

resource.name: Disaster Service Worker Training
resource.description: At least 80% of current staff will have Public Health emergency training on workplace preparedness and their roles as Disaster Service Workers by June 30, 2020.

resource.name: STD Taskforce Meet 2x
resource.description:
Convene a Community STD taskforce with at least one representative from the healthcare, schools and universities, faith-based, and adolescent and young adult (ages 15-29) communities to help address the current rise in STD rates by June 30, 2017.

The Community STD taskforce will meet biannually by June 30, 2021.
columns_description: Location of where meeting took place
The total number of organizations who attended the meeting

resource.name: Development of a Healthy Communities Strategic Plan
resource.description: Develop and disseminate a Healthy Communities strategic plan focused on improving access to healthy foods and active living to 20 community partners by December 31, 2017.
